title: Cannot get eth-brownie installed on Windows 10
body:

Failed to build bitarray cytoolz lru-dict multidict psutil yarl
ERROR: Could not build wheels for multidict, yarl, which is required to install pyproject.toml-based projects

Try using python 3.9.x for now.
Brownie does not currently support 3.10 - at least because the vyper dependency doesn't yet (see vyperlang/vyper#2548)

If you get an error with something like:

error: Microsoft Visual C++ 14.0 is required. Get it with "Microsoft Visual C++ Build Tools"

Youâ€™ll have to do the following:

Download and install the [Build Tools for Visual Studio](https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/visual-cpp-build-tools/), and then install the C++ build tools. Once installed, run the following command in your terminal. [Here is a video tutorial showing you how to install the build tools.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rcI1_e38BWs)

pip install --upgrade setuptools
